title: Zionism Versus Revolutionary Yiddishland | Educate Against Genocide Class 2
description:
Class #2, Held on October 24th

Readings:

https://www.midwesternmarx.com/articles/the-moral-imperative-of-unconditional-decolonization-by-yanis-iqbal

Revolutionary Yiddishland: A History of Jewish Radicalism by Alain Brossat and Sylvie Klingberg, Introduction

Chapter 20 of Palestine, Israel and the U.S. Empire, “Intifada, ‘Peace Process,’ Intifada ” by Richard Becker

The concept of Orientalism: How does the colonizer see the colonized?
https://www.tiktok.com/@rudyayoub/video/7138072436649774382

“The Battle of Algiers”
“The oppressor has no right the oppressed are bound to respect.” -Dr. Huey P. Newton
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wd5Pz8KJeU4

Extra readings on the Zionist vs anti-Zionist left in ‘48 (these readings are not a priority but there is some interesting history here):

“A century after its founding, the Israeli Communist Party is at a crossroads” https://www.972mag.com/israeli-communist-party-maki-century/ (The contradiction between being a communist and being “Israeli." There is some interesting history here but the last paragraph is an anti anti-imperialist stance.)

Vs

Matzpen: a tiny ideologically steeled group of communists who never had more than a few dozen members and were shut down by the zionist state:

https://www.972mag.com/moshe-machover-israeli-anti-zionist-matzpen/
